caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 43.
Ariadna isthmica Beatty, 1970
. Males (Paratype) (AMNH) (A‒D, F) and (Holotype) (MCZ 21712) (E), both from Barro Colorado Island: habitus. dorsal (A) and ventral view (B); left leg I, prolateral (C) and retrolateral view (D); left metatarsus I, ventral view (E); left metatarsus IV, retrolateral view (F). Female from Barro Colorado Island (USNM) (G‒J): habitus, dorsal (G) and ventral view (H); left leg I, prolateral (I) and retrolateral view (J). Scale bar: 1mm.

FIGURE 44.
Ariadna isthmica Beatty, 1970
. Male (Paratype) from Barro Colorado Island (AMNH) (A‒B): left palp, prolateral (A) and retrolateral view (B). Female (Paratype) from Canal Zone Forest Preserve (MCZ 27673) (C‒D): internal genitalia, lateral view (C); anterior receptaculum, ventral view (D). Scale bar: 1mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis.
Ariadna isthmica
is similar to
A. boliviana
,
A. ipojuca
n. sp.
and
A. gaucha
n. sp.
due to the morphology of male palp ( Figs 37A‒B , 44A‒B , 58G‒H , 61A‒B ), metatarsi IV ( Figs 36F , 43F , 58F , 60F ), and leg macrosetae of females, but differ by the presence of sinuous metatarsi I, with both extremes equal in size and similarly bended; basal region prolaterally bended, and distal region retrolaterally ( Fig. 43C‒E ); females differ from these species by the presence of a ventral lobe less sinuous ( Fig. 44C‒D ).
Variation. Male (n=10): Total length 4.52‒7.76; carapace 2.28‒3.68 long, 1.6‒2.72 wide; femur I 2.32‒3.4. Female (n=10): Total length 7.2‒12.48; carapace 3.2‒4.32 long, 2.08‒2.8; femur I 2.32‒2.96.

Distribution. Nicaragua ,
Panama
and north of Brazil ( Fig. 68 ).
